titleStmt.title: [Drawing of mid-18th century Cherokee segmented domestic structure] / [by Thomas Whyte]: a machine-readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Whyte, Thomas R.

availability.p: This work is the property of the McClung Museum, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text.

bibl.title: [Drawing of mid-18th century Cherokee segmented domestic structure] / [by Thomas Whyte]
bibl.author: Whyte, Thomas R.
bibl.note: This is a drawing of a Cherokee segmented domestic structure from the mid-18th century based on archaeological excavations by the University of Tennessee at Overhill Cherokee sites on the lower Little Tennessee River Valley. Excavations of Overhill Cherokee villages were conducted by the University of Tennessee between 1967 and 1983 as part of the Tellico Archaeological Project. Excavations continued until 1983, and laboratory studies and report preparation continued until 1987. The excavations were conducted in anticipation of the flooding of the lower Little Tennessee River Valley, in eastern Tennessee, by the Tellico Dam Reservoir. The excavations were conducted under contract with the National Park Service and the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA).
Frank H. McClung Museum Photographic Collection

projectDesc.p: Prepared for The University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with Microsoft Word spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points

figure.figDesc: Artist drawing of Cherokee segmented domestic structure, mid-18th century, based on archaeological excavations by the University of Tennessee at Overhill Cherokee sites on the Lower Little Tennessee River Valley and contemporary historic descriptions. Drawing by Thomas Whyte. This information was provided by the Frank H. McClung Museum.

p.note: This document consists of one image only.
